reviews.review: A fancy name for the difficult-to-diagnose infection that rapidly spread from one fat redneck to another in the late '90s that resulted in the mutation of the highly sentient parasite scientifically named Randall S Pitchford II. The word Randall is derived from Randi, the Hindi slang for Prostitute. The term Pitchford is derived from surname of the patient zero. The disease was the result of the lack of judgement in the part of the obese white man in charge of turning the Valve. Those who are infected by the parasite feel the need to compulsively watch dirty kiddie films and slowly become diagnosed with Pseudologia Fantastica.
Bardzo przyjemny dodatek, polecam.

Eğer benim gibi bu oyunu oynamayı planlayıp sürekli erteleyenlerdenseniz hiç kasmayın kendinizi direkt alıp oynayın. Oyun süresi hakkında hiçbir fikre sahip değildim lakin aşırı kısaymış 3 saat gibi kısa bir sürede hemencecik bitti. 

   Oyuna gelecek olursam Black Mesa Araştırma Tesisleri'nde güvenlik görevlisi olarak çalışan Barney Calhoun ile onun bu trajedideki serüvenini oynuyoruz. Başta olayları yadırgasam da beni hemencecik içine çekmeyi başardı her şey. Çok uzun uzun anlatılacak bir oyun değil zaten benim de üstüne söyleyebileceğim çok bir şey kalmadı. Eğer halen daha bu oyunu oynamadıysanız kesinlikle oynamanızı öneririm. 

   Hatta son bir şey olarak puzzle mekaniğini de çok sevdim ve puzzle bu kadar zor olmasa oyunu net 2 saatte bitirebilirdim. Zor ve kanserliğin arasındaki ince çizgiyi bozmadan yapmışlar ben çözerken gayet keyif aldım ustaca tasarlanmış her şey.
it gud it cool
Sure it was good, everything Half-Life did in a much shorter time span, Zen Still sucks...

This game is short and sweet, not even Xen overstays its welcome in this game. Fast paced and over before you know it with some enjoyable puzzle solving and a handful of decent action set pieces. 

It doesn't do much that base Half-Life does but it has some unique puzzles that really put all of the limited capacity of the gold source engine on full display mainly pushing and pulling and even a proto buoyancy puzzle.

Solid experience overall even if it could use a few more set pieces to round it out.
its good

Its a great expansion to Half Life, but when it came to Xen (again), I straight up noclipped past the vent maze because it felt really aimless and slow, I didnt know where to go either, but through Opposing Force I had no trouble knowing where to go.

Blue Shift gets a 5/10 from me, I'm fine with it not bring much new to the table, but Xen really made it less enjoyable 

TL:DR: Xen sucks ass, skip it.
OTIS

Со второй попытки все же Gearbox удалось "почувствовать" Half-Life. По сути Blue Shift даже не ощущается чем-то отдельным, в отличии от Opposing Force, а скорее как сейчас это модно - сюжетное DLC. Более медленный геймплей, лучше левел-дизайн и, главное отличие от OF - лучше сбалансирована сложность. Плюс без багов.
8 из 10.

If you enjoyed Half-Life and Half-Life: Opposing Force, you might get some mild amusement from Half-Life: Blue Shift! Starring everyone's favourite slow-walking security officer, Blue Shift sadly does not offer much in the way of variety for those who have already played the prior two games. However, if you are devoted to experiencing the entirety of the Half-Life story, then Blue Shift does indeed make its contribution to the franchise, however uneventful it may be. Best played after a beer, Barney owes you one anyway.

This is the Minecraft of HL games...the sub title should have been called 'Blue-Craft'. Too much box breaking. You can tell that Gearbox took the foot off the gas for this one. Features like lifting objects removed, I had to redo my keys/mouse/sound options every time I started the game or it crashed and I had to restart. 100% the lowest quality of the HL1 games. Having said all that, it's still HL and it's still good. I guess $5 is fair for 4 hours.

A quite good but short game. I like how it expands on the workings of black mesa and it's more general lore expansion. I like the armor system but wish more was added and it's short, like really short. Still, damn good for $5.

Valve was really on a streak back then. Blue Shift is a short yet thrilling ride through the Black Mesa Complex and it delivers on every level, an absolute must for any Half-Life fan.
Short and sweet add-on to Half-Life from the perspective of the nice security guard called Barney Calhoun, who still owes Gordon a beer.

doesn't really matter what people say about the lack of new content.. Its still an enjoyable game that I managed to complete in a 3 hour sitting. They did well with the resources they were given and its not the sort of game that you need to watch a walkthrough to complete. I was never a fan of the HD pack in vanilla Half-Life but it seems to fit alright in Blue Shift. 

If you've got $8 to spare, you might as well give it a go, i don't really have anything negative to say about the game.

The shortest and the weekest game in HL series, although it's still fun to play in 2021. Physics based puzzles might seem infuriating nowadays, but 20 years ago they were actually pretty clever and innovative.

As other classic Half-Life games, it supports wide and ultrawide resolutions "out of the box", and I played the game in 3440x1440@100Hz. Quite an upgrade to my original playthrough way back which was in 800x600...

Tampoco es tan malo como para dejarlo de adorno como los remasters source, los deathmatch y team fortress 1. No lo recomiendo sólo por el precio completo (válgase la redundancia) por lo demás está ok darle una probadita.
